Description: Wooden comb originally with six teeth but one of the end ones is wanting. The handle ends in a zoomorphic(?) terminal and is decorated along the edges with serrations. Four shallow grooves across the face join the serrations and two are found immediately above the teeth. A single circular hole is placed centrally towards the terminal and four are arranged above the teeth. A hair ornament?
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), house LC1-1 room 3 level 8
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
